Submodules

mars.concatination module

mars.constants module

mars.constants.unit_converter(values, conversion)[source]

Convert values (scalar or torch.Tensor on CPU or GPU).

according to the given conversion key.

Parameters:

  • values (torch.Tensor | numpy.ndarray | float) – torch.Tensor, np.ndarray, or float The numerical value(s) to be converted. Can be a scalar, numpy array, or PyTorch tensor (CPU or GPU).

  • conversion (str) –

    str The conversion type specified as “from_to” format. Supported conversions: Energy ↔ Frequency: - “Hz_to_J”: frequency (Hz) → energy (Joules) - “J_to_Hz”: energy (Joules) → frequency (Hz)

    Energy ↔ Temperature: - “J_to_K”: energy (Joules) → temperature (Kelvin) - “K_to_J”: temperature (Kelvin) → energy (Joules)

    Frequency ↔ Temperature: - “Hz_to_K”: frequency (Hz) → temperature (Kelvin) - “K_to_Hz”: temperature (Kelvin) → frequency (Hz)

    Energy/Frequency ↔ Magnetic Field: - “Hz_to_T_e”: frequency (Hz) → magnetic field (Tesla) for electrons - “T_to_Hz_e”: magnetic field (Tesla) → frequency (Hz) for electrons - “Hz_to_T_n”: frequency (Hz) → magnetic field (Tesla) for nuclei - “T_to_Hz_n”: magnetic field (Tesla) → frequency (Hz) for nuclei

    Energy Units: - “J_to_eV”: energy (Joules) → energy (electron volts) - “eV_to_J”: energy (electron volts) → energy (Joules)

    Wavenumber Conversions: - “cm-1_to_Hz”: wavenumber (cm⁻¹) → frequency (Hz) - “Hz_to_cm-1”: frequency (Hz) → wavenumber (cm⁻¹) - “cm-1_to_K”: wavenumber (cm⁻¹) → temperature (Kelvin) - “K_to_cm-1”: temperature (Kelvin) → wavenumber (cm⁻¹) - “cm-1_to_T_e”: wavenumber (cm⁻¹) → magnetic field (Tesla) for electrons - “T_to_cm-1_e”: magnetic field (Tesla) → wavenumber (cm⁻¹) for electrons - “cm-1_to_T_n”: wavenumber (cm⁻¹) → magnetic field (Tesla) for nuclei - “T_to_cm-1_n”: magnetic field (Tesla) → wavenumber (cm⁻¹) for nuclei

mars.utils module

mars.utils.apply_expanded_rotations(R, T)[source]

Rotate tensor T with respect to rotation matrices R according formula T’ = RTR’.

Parameters:

  • R (torch.Tensor) – the rotation matrices. The shape is [*rotation_dims, 3, 3]

  • T (torch.Tensor) – tensor that must be rotated. The shape is [… 3, 3]

Returns:

The rotated tensors with the shape […, *rotation_dims, 3, 3]

mars.utils.apply_single_rotation(R, T)[source]

Rotate tensor T with respect to rotation matrices R using T’ = R T R^T.

Applies a single rotation matrix (or a batch of rotation matrices) to a tensor using the transformation T’ = R T R^T.

Parameters:

  • R (torch.Tensor) – The rotation matrices with shape […, 3, 3].

  • T (torch.Tensor) – The tensor to be rotated with shape […, 3, 3].

Returns:

The rotated tensors with shape […, 3, 3].

mars.utils.calculate_deriv_max(g_tensors_el, g_factors_nuc, el_numbers, nuc_numbers)[source]

Calculate the maximum value of the energy derivatives with respect to magnetic field.

It is assumed that B has direction along z-axis :param g_tensors_el: g-tensors of electron spins. The shape is […, 3, 3] :param g_factors_nuc: g-factors of the nuclei spins. The shape is […] :param el_numbers: electron spin quantum numbers :param nuc_numbers: nuclei spins quantum numbers :return: the maximum value of the energy derivatives with respect to magnetic field

Parameters:

  • g_tensors_el (torch.Tensor)

  • g_factors_nuc (torch.Tensor)

  • el_numbers (torch.Tensor)

  • nuc_numbers (torch.Tensor)

Return type:

torch.Tensor

mars.utils.rotation_matrix_to_euler_angles(R, convention='zyz')[source]

Convert a 3x3 rotation matrix to ZYZ Euler angles.

Parameters:

  • R (torch.Tensor)

  • convention (str)

mars.utils.euler_angles_to_matrix(angles, convention='zyz')[source]
Parameters:

  • euler_angles – torch.Tensor of shape (…, 3) containing Euler angles in radians.

  • convention (str) – str, rotation convention (default ‘zyz’) Supported: ‘zyz’, ‘xyz’, ‘xzy’, ‘yxz’, ‘yzx’, ‘zxy’, ‘zyx’

  • angles (torch.Tensor)

Returns:

torch.Tensor of shape (…, 3, 3) containing rotation matrices

mars.utils.mean_rotation_svd(Rs)[source]

Compute mean rotation matrix as SVD projection of mean value of rotation matrices.

Parameters:

Rs (torch.Tensor) – rotation matrices with shape […, n, 3, 3], where n is number for mean computation.

Returns:

R_mean - mean rotation matrix with shape […, 3, 3]

mars.utils.get_canonical_orientations(angles)[source]

Compute Canonical angles for set of angles using SVD mean projection.

Parameters:

angles (torch.Tensor) – euler angles in convention zyz. The shape is […, n, 3], where n is set size

Returns:

Canonical angles

mars.utils.float_to_complex_dtype(dtype)[source]
Parameters:

dtype (torch.dtype)
